li.Qualified students may apply after compl: Qualified students may apply after completion of a minimum of 64 credit hours.
li.Completion of no more than 96 credit hou: Completion of no more than 96 credit hours.
li.A minimum UCF GPA of at least 3.2 in all: A minimum UCF GPA of at least 3.2 in all upper division courses.
li.Courses that must be completed with a \": Courses that must be completed with a "B" or better for eligibility: EGN 3331C (Mechanics of Materials), CWR 4202C (Hydraulics), CGN 3405 (Numerical Methods) and STA 3032 (Probability and Statistics)
li.Admission to the Accelerated Program doe: Admission to the Accelerated Program does not guarantee formal admission to the MSCE, MS Transportation Systems, MS Water Resources, or MS Structural and Geotechnical program.
li.Admission is not automatic. Interested s: Admission is not automatic. Interested students may need to be interviewed.

courseSection0.text:
Admission Requirements
See Common Program Prerequisites.
Qualified students may apply after completion of a minimum of 64 credit hours.
Completion of no more than 96 credit hours.
A minimum UCF GPA of at least 3.2 in all upper division courses.
Courses that must be completed with a "B" or better for eligibility: EGN 3331C (Mechanics of Materials), CWR 4202C (Hydraulics), CGN 3405 (Numerical Methods) and STA 3032 (Probability and Statistics)
Admission to the Accelerated Program does not guarantee formal admission to the MSCE, MS Transportation Systems, MS Water Resources, or MS Structural and Geotechnical program.
Admission is not automatic. Interested students may need to be interviewed.

li.Two years of foreign language in high sc: Two years of foreign language in high school, or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.
li.Civil engineering students must take the: Civil engineering students must take the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) Exam during their Senior year.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Each engineering student is assigned a q: Each engineering student is assigned a qualified engineering academic advisor in the department of his/her major. Each student should seek academic advisement before registering for classes each semester to minimize excess hours and to ensure that satisfactory academic progress is being maintained.
li.The following will be waived for this jo: The following will be waived for this joint degree program:
li.The limit of nine hours to be shared bet: The limit of nine hours to be shared between undergraduate and graduate programs.
li.Undergraduate students taking graduate c: Undergraduate students taking graduate courses must be within nine hours of graduation
Undergraduate students taking graduate courses must not register for more than a total of twelve hours in that semester
li.Undergraduate students are not eligible: Undergraduate students are not eligible to take 6000-level courses
li.Shared B.S.C.E./M.S.C.E, M.S. Smart Citi: Shared B.S.C.E./M.S.C.E, M.S. Smart Cities, M.S. Transportation, M.S. Water Resources, M.S. Structural and Geotechnical
li.Up to 12 credit hours of approved 5000 a: Up to 12 credit hours of approved 5000 and 6000 level courses with grades of "B" (3.0) or better may be counted towards the B.S. and Masters degrees. These 12 credit hours will meet either technical elective or course requirements for the major. Contact the Graduate Coordinator in the Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering department for a list of acceptable courses.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection2.text:
Admissions
Two years of foreign language in high school, or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.

courseSection4.text:
Additional Requirements

Civil engineering students must take the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) Exam during their Senior year.

courseSection7.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection14.text:
Advising Notes

Each engineering student is assigned a qualified engineering academic advisor in the department of his/her major. Each student should seek academic advisement before registering for classes each semester to minimize excess hours and to ensure that satisfactory academic progress is being maintained.
The following will be waived for this joint degree program:
The limit of nine hours to be shared between undergraduate and graduate programs.
Undergraduate students taking graduate courses must be within nine hours of graduation
Undergraduate students taking graduate courses must not register for more than a total of twelve hours in that semester
Undergraduate students are not eligible to take 6000-level courses

courseSection16.text:
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses

None

courseSection17.text:
Shared Cores

Shared B.S.C.E./M.S.C.E, M.S. Smart Cities, M.S. Transportation, M.S. Water Resources, M.S. Structural and Geotechnical
Up to 12 credit hours of approved 5000 and 6000 level courses with grades of "B" (3.0) or better may be counted towards the B.S. and Masters degrees. These 12 credit hours will meet either technical elective or course requirements for the major. Contact the Graduate Coordinator in the Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering department for a list of acceptable courses.

courseSection19.text:
Program Academic Learning Compacts

Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection20.text:

Full-Time Student: $85 per term
